snippet: Vilyam and Mayya Gil left Ukraine 22 years ago to follow one of their twins, Larisa, to New York. When she died last year, the Gils struggled to afford a gravestone.
abstract: Edith and Carl Marks Jewish Community House of Bensonhurst, beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York, one of the organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides $1,000 to Ukrainian immigrants Mayya and Vilyam Gil to cover remaining balance on gravestone for their daughter, who is buried on Staten Island.
lead_paragraph: Vilyam and Mayya Gil left Ukraine 22 years ago to follow one of their twins, Larisa, to New York. When she died last year, the Gils struggled to afford a gravestone.

headline.main: A Final Tribute for a Daughter Who Died From a Secret Illness
headline.print_headline: A Final Tribute for a Daughter Who Died From a Secret Illness
